captions.text:
Based on the book that inspired a million
crying girls' Tumblr posts...

Comes the romance that did for cancer what
Twilight did for vampires.

Ride along for a touching story about how
one girl's cancer led to fun,

But instead of sugarcoating the truth, get
ready for two well-rounded characters with

She's a smart young girl who's more than
just a cancer survivor:

"Depression's not a side-effect of cancer;
it's a side-effect of dying."

"Hey, I just wanted to say that you know there's
gonna come a time when all of us are dead."
"You just die in the middle of life."

Hazel's world will transform when she attends
the most adorable

There, she'll meet fellow survivor Augustus
Waters,

a confident, 6 foot 4, well-spoken, adorkable,
polite, funny, star-athlete, philosopher-poet

Together, they'll bond over a book with
a title just as pretentious as "The Fault

And their shared habit of talking like really
weird old people.
"Your daughter, she's done a great injustice."

"You have no idea how utterly unprecedented
you are."
"I am in the midst of a grand soliloquy here!"

"Welcome to the sweet torture of reading An
Imperial Affliction."

Follow Gus' heroic struggle to get into
a dying girls pants,

a struggle so difficult he has to read her
favorite book.
Score her a meeting with its reclusive author,

and exploit a cancer charity to send them
on a dream vacation, just to get out of the

Say "OK" to a PG-13 film that glorifies
underage drinking,

And making out in the room where Anne Frank
was abducted, with no consideration for the
people who came there to honor the Holocaust.
Uhhh, not sure that warrants a slowclap but...

So cuddle up for a beautiful finale where
our star-crossed lovers have a moment of true

a close friend getting dumped for just for
going blind! The bitch!,
Willem Dafoe being a dream-crushing dick,

Teenagers with cancer attending their own
practice funeral,

"You gave me forever within a number of days,
and for that I am eternally grateful!"
Oh That's Ansel, He's So Hot Right Now

That Guy Who Showed His Butt A Lot on True
Blood

"You put the thing that does the killing right
between your teeth but you never give it the

He totally stole that from Gettin' Jiggy Wit'
It.

"Ciga-cigar right from Cuba-Cuba. I just bite
it, it's for the look, I don't light it."

comments.text:
It's a good movie but missing out something. Even the famous "okay scene" 
is not that touching for me. I watched other movie (I wouldn't mention the 
title to avoid spoiler), but I didn't know it also has "okay scene", and I 
think it successfully delivers what TFIOS wanted to: Reassurance from your 
important person that even though things seem complicated, s/he'll stay by 
your side. I don't like how they messed around in the cancer support group 
and in the museum too. Just not my taste I guess.﻿

comments.text:
This book was so pretentious, and I'm so pretentious I thought it was the 
"realest" thing I had ever read. It was like an extended think piece and it 
was awesome. Granted, I have been a pretentious seventeen year old, and 
NOBODY who is pretentious at seventeen has figured out how to make it cute 
yet. We mostly exist in our corners, thinking that "everyone's a fucking 
idiot" while we listen to indie rock. Now I'm a pretentious twenty year old 
and still trying to figure it all out.﻿
